data.name: Pacific Gas & Electric Company PG&E
data.description: Pacific Gas & Electric Company PG&E is a leading utility provider in California, committed to delivering safe, reliable electricity to its customers. PG&E serves millions of households and businesses, focusing on safety and sustainability.
data.emergency_steps:
1. If you suspect a gas leak, do not use any electrical devices, as a spark could ignite the gas.  
2. Evacuate the building immediately if you suspect a gas line is broken.  
3. Once safely away from the building, call 9-1-1 to report the gas leak.  
4. After contacting emergency services, call PG&E at 1-800-743-5000 to report the situation.  
5. Avoid returning to the building until it is declared safe by authorities.

Non-Emergency Tips:  
- Have a backup phone that does not rely on electricity to ensure communication during outages.  
- Spend time with friends or family during outages, or consider using a backup generator for essential needs pge.com.
